alert.note: Alert for Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:27AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Nicholas and southwestern Webster Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 227 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Craigsville, or 8 miles northwest of Richwood, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Richwood, Camden-On-gauley, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Calvin, and Nettie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster
